data.title: `workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument` unexpectedly reports changes with the file version from the source control
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.0-insider (1.8.0-insider) 6a6ab1fc5e58227b56ffc3e5bea9951e5565c314
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12

Something very strange happened to `workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument`, it looks like it now reports changes to the file by comparing its version with the Git stored version, or something like that.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an extension with one line:
```javascript
workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument(event => console.log(event));
```
2. Checkout any project from Git
3. Open Dev Tools
4. Open any file of the project from Git, change the file, observe the correct and expected change reported to the console
5. **Save** the file, wait few seconds, and observe the unexpectedly reported change (also check the event `contentChanges[0].text`)

data.title: Handlebars Syntax Highlighting broken when a string is used as second or subsequent helper argument
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider (6a6ab1fc5e58227b56ffc3e5bea9951e5565c314) - OS Version: macOS 10.11.6 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a handlebars file 2. Use a helper and use a string as the second or subsequent argument 3. Content of the handlebars file that comes after the helper is not correctly highlighted When you use the string as the first or only argument everything highlights correctly: As soon as you put an argument in front of the string everything afterwards won't be highlighted correctly anymore:

data.title: Extension overlays are being stripped from the screen
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (731c1b034ed009991c29f9ccaf035c236458e3c6, 2016-11-23T07:09:34.296Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.1.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.0|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.10|
|vscode-subword-navigation|ow|1.1.5|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.0.2|
|annotator|ryu1kn|0.10.1|
|cucumber|stevejpurves|0.9.6|
|wallaby-vscode|WallabyJs|1.0.30|

---

I'm not sure if this is a bug in the Wallaby extension or VSCode.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone this repo: https://github.com/massimocode/javascript-exercises
2. NPM install
3. Make sure you have the wallaby extension installed in VS Code
4. Open the file spec\core-javascript\arrays.spec.js
5. Start the wallaby extension
6. You should see coloured dots appear on the side. However, after a few seconds they disappear. Make a change (i.e. press space or remove a semicolon or something) and they appear again. Again, after a few seconds they disappear.

data.title: React/tsx/jsx alignment behavior [need more info | feature request]
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: 10.12.1

I want tag closing on its own line and aligned with opening of tag if the tag is self closing and expand to multiline

with vscode's default autoformat 
```
      <div
        role='textarea'
        style={{ border: '1px solid black' }}
        >
        <Editor
          editorState={editorState}
          onChange={this.onChange}
          handleKeyCommand={this.handleKeyCommand}
          />
      </div >
```

and what I want is below
```
      <div
        role='textarea'
        style={{ border: '1px solid black' }} >
        <Editor
          editorState={editorState}
          onChange={this.onChange}
          handleKeyCommand={this.handleKeyCommand}
        />
      </div >
```

data.title: Accented letters duplicated when typing next character
data.body:
- VSCode Version: **1.8.0-insider** 6a6ab1fc5e58227b56ffc3e5bea9951e5565c314
- OS Version: **macOS 10.12.1**

![output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2991143/20596299/1f7979c4-b23e-11e6-881c-e45fc1d19281.gif)

This error seems to appears on VSCode Insiders only, VSCode 1.7.2 does not reproduce this behaviour.

I have a French Keyboard, mapped with `U.S International - PC`.

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Begin typing an accent (e.g. `Alt` + `E` to begin a acute)
2. Type the letter you want to put accent on
3. Type a next character
4. Accented letter is now duplicated.

> This does not happen when using the macOS accented letters box by pressing the letter during a certain time. But it's slower.

data.title: OverflowError: in method 'SBInstructionList_GetInstructionAtIndex'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2|
|vscode-lldb|vadimcn|0.3.1|
|debug|webfreak|0.12.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. On OS X, launched a C program using "type":"lldb", tried to step or some such (just getting started with vscode). Suddenly debugee hung and vscode "Continue" button does nothing. Debug Console showed the following error message:

[11:13:32 debugsession] Internal debugger error:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./adapter/debugsession.py", line 695, in handle_message
    result = handler(args)
  File "./adapter/debugsession.py", line 407, in DEBUG_stackTrace
    dasm = disassembly.Disassembly(pc_sbaddr, self.target)
  File "./adapter/disassembly.py", line 62, in __init__
    last_instr = self.instructions[len(self.instructions)-1]
  File "/Applications/Xcode_8_1.app/Contents/SharedFrameworks/LLDB.framework/Resources/Python/lldb/__init__.py", line 5267, in __getitem__
    return self.GetInstructionAtIndex(key)
  File "/Applications/Xcode_8_1.app/Contents/SharedFrameworks/LLDB.framework/Resources/Python/lldb/__init__.py", line 5236, in GetInstructionAtIndex
    return _lldb.SBInstructionList_GetInstructionAtIndex(self, *args)
OverflowError: in method 'SBInstructionList_GetInstructionAtIndex', argument 2 of type 'uint32_t'

data.title: VS Code can only load on folder
data.body: Can vs code load mutiple root folder like sublime ?

data.title: Extension UI contributions: how to find out from which extension a contribution was made?
data.body:
Extensions can write code to contribute UI pieces in various places, e.g.:
* status bar entries
* output channels
* upcoming: viewlets

We would like to allow e.g. on status bar entries and viewlets to right click -> manage extension so that people can enable/disable UI components.

Now, I am not seeing a way to find out which extension calls the methods to register. 

What is the strategy here? Should we add parameters to the methods so that an extension has to send its extension ID? Can we run the extension code in an environment where we know which extension we are talking to?

/cc @jrieken @alexandrudima

data.title: Infinite FileWatcher start->crash loop
data.body:
Testing on windows 7 and after opening a folder I see an endless loop of the FileWatcher process crashing and starting. This is how it reproduces

* win7 VM 
* open VS Code
* open a folder that is shared from the mac (Mac Desktop in my case)
* 🐛 open dev tools, see endless errors about the file watcher crashing

![nov-24-2016 10-37-08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/20593369/6b8cc7c8-b232-11e6-8aa6-8f69af2457e4.gif)

data.title: Enable PHP syntax highlighting without <?php, also fix markdown + PHP code fence issues
data.body:
* Provide a new language (phplanguage) for reference by services requiring PHP syntax highlighting for code without script/start end tags. 
* Add workaround to prevent phplanguage from appearing in Language Mode list 
* fix markdown + PHP fenced code blocks
  * previously PHP wasn't working at all because we don't appear to properly support injections. This issue was addressed by pointing to a specific repository key (#languages).
  * ensure "fuzzy" syntax highlighting for PHP/HTML code so that script start tags are not required

close #14166, close #3746

data.title: Feature Request
data.body: FTP Upload like NetBeans with file selection, Sync and download.

data.title: Add option to force a maximum number of consecutive blank lines in files
data.body: I know this can be resolved with extensions, but this is a very common and language neutral feature. Please consider this for addition to core.

data.title: Control Characters (LF, CR) are not shown in editor
data.body:
At least on my Linux machine the rendering of (some) control characters does not work. I'm interested to see **LF or LFCR** at the end of each line.

Neither `Toggle Control Characters`, nor workspace settings `"editor.renderControlCharacters": true` change anything.

Here is a screenshot:
![vscode_control_characters](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2767014/20590226/274b09c2-b222-11e6-98d1-7768c53021f4.png)

- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version:  Ubuntu Gnome/Mutter 14.04, Kernel 4.4.0

This issue is somehow related to [this one](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12760), but has a different focus.

data.title: Dirty diff: changes no longer removed when staging or committing
data.body: We used to hide dirty changes once staged to the index which was a very cool feature. Looks like we lost it in our current insider builds.

data.title: Color update: title, activity bar, status, tabs, panel
data.body:
**Changes**:
* custom title bar on mac to get same color as activity bar and status bar
* status bar to get the same color as activity bar and status bar (unless debugging, empty workspace)
* activity bar gets a VS-Light theme coloring
* less borders around tabs
* panel to get same background color as viewlet and a slight border to the left as separator to distinguish from the editor area

**Try Out**:
* Open settings and configure `"update.channel": "none"` to disable automatic updates
* Mac: [Download](https://az764295.vo.msecnd.net/insider/fd4d938088d3ee94810daaa07ba9a234ecf89ca9/VSCode-darwin-insider.zip)
* Linux: [Download](https://az764295.vo.msecnd.net/insider/fd4d938088d3ee94810daaa07ba9a234ecf89ca9/code-insider-1.8.0-1479974168_amd64.tar.gz)
* Windows: [Download](https://az764295.vo.msecnd.net/insider/fd4d938088d3ee94810daaa07ba9a234ecf89ca9/VSCode-win32-1.8.0-insider.zip)

**Dark Theme**

**Light Theme**

**HC Theme**

data.title: Can't jump to file by click path in error stack in the console.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 64bit
- lanch type: node2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Configure and use `babel` in develop environment
2. `throw new Error('message')` 

Can't open file "...": Can't find file (...).
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5998826/20589026/84d897f8-b254-11e6-9b95-2e47ac5b4d0c.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5998826/20589018/7c86da38-b254-11e6-8118-b10183898719.png)

The path don't contain “disk symbol” `x`, it can be see throw the underline in the second picture.
Because it can't correctly identify path in `at _callee$ (...)` like
```
at _callee$ (x:/git/nodejs/cms/src/app_server/controllers/api.admin.js:10:9)
```

1.当我的js代码写在html文件中时，使用快捷键cmd+/去注释一段代码时，编辑器使用的注释方法还是html的<!---->方法，而不是js的//或者/**/的方法，这样是无效的。

}

data.title: Supported File Live Previews
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12 Public Beta (16B2657)

My idea is to open files supported by the OS, VSC extensions, etc as a file in preview mode. For example, right clicking an html file then clicking "Open as Preview" will open a new tab as if its a file and show the contents in a simple frame. If you are wanting to see an example I've edited to look like the new feature I'm requesting, well here you go...

![](http://i.imgur.com/gUeMsUo.jpg)
![](http://i.imgur.com/Knt9UsA.jpg)

I'm sorry, I'm not the best at photoshopping but I did my best. This is kind of what I mean. If the file is being view without a workspace (alone as a single file), then there would be a button next to "Split view" at the top right near the exit button that will open the file as a preview file if it is supported by an extension, software, raw file view by OS or is supported by VSC. If the file you want to preview is in a workspace (currently open is a folder viewing workspace), then there would be an option to right click the file then "Open as Preview" or the same way you would open it as a singular file (without workspace). I tried my best to explain what I mean but if you are still having trouble understanding, just take a look at the images above. Please note that there is a reload button on the top right of the preview side of the second image, that will reload the preview to be updated with the code. A second idea (possibility) is a JavaScript Developer Console can be put below the preview with JavaScript errors, warnings and logs like Chrome does but that is optional.

data.title: Line change highlight persists through git commit
data.body:
**Problem**: The line highlight to show lines that changed persists through git commit. See http://zc.d.pr/spFD/1sEx17Pf

**Expected**: The line highlight disappears on commit -- this is the old behaviour and let me easily see what was changed since the last commit. The only way to make it disappear at the moment is to restart VSCode.

- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 insiders 731c1b034ed009991c29f9ccaf035c236458e3c6 2016-11-23T07:03:07.898Z
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Change a line
2.  Commit the change

data.title: Incorrect license on RPM
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2-1479766213
- OS Version: el7

The license listed in the RPM is MIT, however the license link in the Help menu goes to https://code.visualstudio.com/license?lang=en 

The license in the spec file should be something like 'Microsoft Visual Studio Code License' ... unless you are deliberately re-licensing it for us, then just change the URL in the menu :P
